abstracts.cdata!:
The environmental assessment contains
            two volumes, the first focuses primarily on the hulk removal
            of a mineral cargo ship from the Tolagnaro Bay, followed by
            the rehabilitation of two other ports, and river control
            management; and, the second, examines the impact as a result
            of roads construction. Volume I addresses pollution risks
            associated to the continuous manganese, and hydrocarbon
            spillage from the hulk's cargo, whose toxic products
            endangers local ecosystems. The removal works will further
            increase serious air, and water pollution in the bay, in
            addition to the economic adversity, resulting from higher
            transportation costs due to shipping de-tours, and illicit
            trafficking. Mitigation measures recommend: 1)
            implementation of ecological, and biological studies to
            identify negative pollution impacts; 2) performance of
            toxicity tests on fisheries products; 3) regulation of
            fishing activities, and adequate dredging to prevent land
            degradation, flora and fauna disturbances, and, sanitary
            measures should be enforced. Volume II identifies adverse
            effects during, and after road construction, such as
            potential water, air, and noise pollution, and, ecological
            damage. Measures to mitigate adverse effects call for: 1)
            judicious practices on site selection; 2) noise abatement
            measures, including the construction of sound barriers; 3)
            enforcement of traffic safety measures; and, 4) public
            awareness development.
